revised_title: Understanding and Mitigating Spurious Correlation in Statistical Analysis
tldr: In this article, Francis Galton discusses the concept of spurious correlation and its impact on statistical analysis. He explains how the use of indices can lead to misleading correlations and provides an example of how to identify and mitigate this issue. Galton's work is important for both practical statisticians and those studying the correlation of physical or economic phenomena.
